newsitem.title: UK: UK generators up as Goldman repeats positive view.
newsitem.headline: UK generators up as Goldman repeats positive view.

text.p: Shares in UK electricity generators Powergen and National Power rose on Tuesday after Goldman Sachs reiterated its market outperform rating and said they offered compelling long-term fundamental value, market sources said.
By 0908 GMT, PowerGen was trading 3-1/2p higher at 480p and National Power 4p ahead at 383-1/2p.

Taking into account a possible 200 million stg windfall levy on Powergen and 300 million stg on National Power in the event of a Labour government, Goldman analyst Philip Green estimates the shares are at about a 30 percent discount to fair value.
Earnings estimates have been reduced slightly to reflect the inclusion of any windfall levy.
Green is also forecasting dividend growth for National Power of 10 percent to 2000 and 15 percent for Powergen coming partly from the balance sheet and partly inherent growth in the business.
The generators will also benefit from international businesses which will help support dividend growth going forward, according to Green.
